meanings.definition: Making someone very weak and infirm
meanings.sent1: The debilitating illness left him unable to walk without assistance.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed rest to help with the debilitating fatigue.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner found it amusing how a simple cold could be so debilitating.
meanings.sent4: The weight of his worries was as debilitating as carrying a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The image of the towering mountain was as debilitating as the actual climb.

meanings.definition: Causing someone to become very weak and infirm
meanings.sent1: Her debilitating injury required months of physical therapy to recover.
meanings.sent2: The extreme heat was debilitating, making it hard to even move.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a tiny ant being debilitating to a giant elephant was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise of the city was as debilitating as a never-ending drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The fear of failure was as debilitating as a heavy weight on his shoulders.

meanings.definition: Having a very harmful effect on someone's strength or abilities
meanings.sent1: The lack of sleep had a debilitating impact on her concentration.
meanings.sent2: The toxic work environment was debilitating to the employees' morale.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how a simple typo could be so debilitating to the project.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal felt by her friend was as debilitating as a deep wound.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise was as debilitating as a constant barrage of arrows.
